content: @Alya Abbott We had a private discussion about showing bot icons in more places, as well as introducing some icon for disabled users that we can display in basically the same places as the bot icons. I am opening this topic for public discussion.

is it fair to say that anywhere a username can appear/mention, a bot can appear and should get the bot-icon ?

here's a preliminary list, scanning the UI:

  1. compose window: @mentions of bots
  2. compose window: recipients list i.e. when sending a msg to a bot
  3. message render: bot is sender
  4. message render: @mentions of bots
  5. active users list, i.e. what bots were recently active (?). note: users can set their status-icon to "bot" like below:
  6. users you've received PMs from (top-left: "Private messages")
  7. PMs from one sender to you (/#narrow/pm-with)
  8. digest: sender
  9. digest: @mention
  10. manage streams / subscribers
  11. /#recent_topics - bot icon only (but maybe want to indicate that it's a bot? seems like this UI doesn't scale anyway...)
  12. /#organization/user-list-admin
  13. /#organization/deactivated-users-admin (?)
  14. (tbd in the mobile UI...)

example of user status as "bot" (assuming we care about bots appearing in the userlist...)
image.png
Seems fair. I think we should definitely address a reasonable subset of these, if not all cases. Thanks for enumerating these use case. This is super helpful!

Hi @Alya Abbott I am working on a project for a class, and my team and I wanted to work on issue #21438. We see that the person who opened the issue is not active anymore, but we wanted confirmation from you that if we were able to fix it you would be able to merge it within 2 weeks. Thanks!

@Keerthana Vinay As discussed in the contributor guide, you should select an issue with the "help wanted" label to work on. What's relevant is how the issue is tagged, not who opened it.

We cannot guarantee a specific timeline for when your PR would be merged, as it depends greatly on the quality of the PR and how much iteration is required.
